title: REVIEW  ---  Play:  News Quiz  ----  By Daniel Akst
text:
1. In a move with financial ramifications for Europe, Mario Draghi resigned -- as what?

A. President of the European Central Bank

B. Chief of the Bank for International Settlements

C. Prime minister of Italy

D. President of Italy

---

2. What just hit $416,000?

A. A pound of London broil

B. The median price of a home

C. The mean household net worth

D. The nice household net worth

---

3. Mills College, in Oakland, Calif., will stay open by merging -- with whom?

A. Hillsdale College

B. Stanford University

C. Northwestern University

D. Northeastern University

---

4. Vernova was in the news. Why?

A. The discovery of codenamed Soviet cables shed new light on the Alger Hiss case.

B. The innovative glass-maker went public.

C. A new staging casts women as Shakespeare's two gentlemen.

D. It will become the name of GE's power business.

---

5. Five-time champion Magnus Carlsen shocked the chess world -- how?

A. By switching to backgammon

B. By declining to defend his title next year

C. By flunking the Norwegian bar exam

D. By solving the Adler Variation on the Budapest Gambit

---

6. Controversy erupted over reports that House Speaker Nancy Pelosi would visit which country?

A. Taiwan

B. Israel

C. China

D. Venezuela

---

7. President Biden got Covid. What treatment was he given?

A. Ivermectin

B. Paxlovid

C. Tamiflu

D. Fake poll results

---

8. Who might face billions in liabilities on their military earplug business?

A. 3M

B. Boeing

C. Pfizer

D. Raytheon

---

9. A new exhibit at the Clark Art Institute includes "The Thinker," sculpted by whom?

A. Auguste Rodin

B. Edgar Degas

C. Niki de Saint Phalle

D. Frederic Auguste Bartholdi

---

ANSWERS

1. C

2. B

3. D

4. D

5. B

6. A

7. B

8. A

9. A
